modName: Fortify Armor Rating Enchantment by Oppaiko
summary: Adds an enchantment to boost armor rating magically, and two craftable items that can be disenchanted.
descriptionHtml:
B A C K G R O U N D

I like the idea of wearing armor increasing jewelry, but "adding an armor rating" to a ring, without magic seems cheep and cheezy to me.  So I got tired of not having any means to enchant jewelry with an armor boost.  So in frustration, I made my own mod.

*Please note: My images use Better Circlets HQ V1o1 by Yuril, which I HIGHLY recommend, found here:  

http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/6495//?

A Q U I S I T I O N

There are two recipies that can be created:

The circlet
This requires several daedra hearts, a filled grand soul gem, and a silver and moonstone circlet.  It will produce an armor boost of 100.

The Ring
The ring requires the componants for a silver and amythest ring (silver ingot, and amythest,) a single daedra heart, and a filled greater 
soul gem.  The ring will produce an armor boost of 15.


These can be disenchanted, and the enchantment learned.  My in-story thinking is that creating the new spell required a deadra heart, and particular materials to focus them.  The newly created ring will produce a little more armor than enchanting a ring once the spell has been created, due to the daedra heart.  

This is sort of a quick and dirty mod.  It should be highly compatible with other mods.  I only used the primary skyrim.esp file as the base, and created all new form IDs.

I hope you enjoy!

- Emily (AKA: Oppaiko)

Updated to v1.01:  Renamed the circlet and changed the visual effect, which is also now temporary.
Item names:  
    Ring: "Ring of Minor Armor"  
    Circlet:  "Major Circlet of Armor"
author: Oppaiko
